tips.text: The CAO applies to all employees with an employment contract in the European part of the Netherlands.
The CAO came into effect on January 1, 2024.
The CAO can be modified by mutual agreement between employer and employee.
Your employment contract must be in writing.
Internal candidates are preferred for vacancies unless business interests dictate otherwise.
The employer covers the costs of any required medical examinations.
Your salary is determined by the salary scale corresponding to your position.
Salary is paid monthly by the employer.
You may be eligible for salary supplements, which are also paid monthly.
Various allowances may be available depending on your position and circumstances.
Your working hours follow the employer's working time regulations.
The employer may modify working time regulations.
You are entitled to leave according to the employer's leave regulations.
Sick leave must be reported to your employer immediately.
Either party may terminate the employment contract.
You are entitled to severance pay if terminated.
The employer must follow specific termination procedures.
You must maintain confidentiality of information entrusted to you.
You need employer permission for any side activities.
You must use employer property carefully and responsibly.
Disputes should first be resolved through mutual consultation.
The CAO can be modified by either party with mutual agreement.
The AAC-DO handles disputes between parties.
The ABP manages pension benefits for employees.
Your pension rights are based on your employment history.
Additional benefits may be available beyond basic unemployment benefits.
The AOW eligibility age determines when state pension benefits begin.
Your employment history affects your unemployment benefits.
Special provisions apply to employees working abroad.
The CAO includes specific provisions for former employees receiving benefits.
